summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. It outlines the status of documents, reasons for postponing the release of certain information, and includes specific payroll authorization forms for Leodis C. Matthews, who was hired as a Senior Staff Attorney. Additionally, it contains a memorandum about payroll certification and the employment details of Mr. Matthews.
key_findings: The release of some document parts was postponed to protect personal privacy, specifically due to the inclusion of Social Security numbers.
Leodis C. Matthews was hired as a Senior Staff Attorney with an annual salary of $30,000.00.
The document sheds light on the payroll authorization and certification procedures within the U.S. House of Representatives.
It underscores the ongoing historical interest in the JFK assassination records and the meticulous approach to handling sensitive information.
